abstract: Republican presidential candidates crisscrossing Iowa have issued hard-line policy statements on illegal immigration at campaign stops across state; residents of Muscatine County in eastern part of state, offer different and perhaps unexpected view on subject; area is well over thousand miles from Mexican border, but county's farms, factories and meat-processing plants are source of income for immigrants, with foreign-born population more than doubling in last two decades.
lead_paragraph: Farms and factories in eastern Iowa have long been a draw for immigrants, and many argue that a one-size-fits-all approach to immigration reform might not work.

headline.main: Iowans Question G.O.P. Talk on Illegal Immigration
headline.print_headline: Slice of Iowa Where Hard Line on Immigrants Doesn’t Apply

snippet: Farms and factories in eastern Iowa have long been a draw for immigrants, and many argue that a one-size-fits-all approach to immigration reform might not work.
